trans-unit.target: Este documento explica en su mayor parte la

trans-unit.source: This document needs a rewrite that separates the tutorial content from the reference content.
trans-unit.target: Este documento necesita una reescritura que separe el contenido del tutorial del contenido de referencia.

trans-unit.source: This document provides a general overview of the capabilities and limitations of the fork() emulation. Note that the issues discussed here are not applicable to platforms where a real fork() is available and Perl has been configured to use it.
trans-unit.target: Este documento ofrece una visión general de las capacidades y limitaciones de la emulación de fork().Nótese que las cuestiones aquí tratadas no son aplicables a las plataformas en las que se dispone de un fork()real y Perl ha sido configurado para utilizarlo.

trans-unit.source: This document provides a reference for Perl's object orientation features. If you're looking for an introduction to object-oriented programming in Perl, please see perlootut.
trans-unit.target: Este documento proporciona una referencia para las funciones de orientación de objetos de Perl. Si está buscando una introducción a la programación orientada a objetos en Perl, consulte perlootut .

trans-unit.source: This document provides an introduction to object-oriented programming in Perl. It begins with a brief overview of the concepts behind object oriented design. Then it introduces several different OO systems from CPAN which build on top of what Perl provides.
trans-unit.target: Este documento proporciona una introducción a la programación orientada a objetos en Perl. Comienza con una breve descripción de los conceptos detrás del diseño orientado a objetos. Luego presenta varios sistemas OO diferentes de CPAN que se basan en lo que proporciona Perl.

trans-unit.source: This document provides an introduction to object-oriented programming in Perl. It begins with a brief overview of the concepts behind object oriented design. Then it introduces several different OO systems from CPAN which build on top of what Perl provides.
This document provides an overview of how the Perl interpreter works at the level of C code, along with pointers to the relevant C source code files.
trans-unit.target: Este documento ofrece una visión general de cómo funciona el intérprete de Perl a nivel de código C,junto con indicaciones sobre los archivos de código fuente C pertinentes.

trans-unit.source: This document provides details on using git to develop Perl. If you are just interested in working on a quick patch, see perlhack first. This document is intended for people who are regular contributors to Perl, including those with write access to the git repository.

This document provides information about the portion of the Unicode database that deals with character properties, that is the portion that is defined on single code points. ("Other information in the Unicode data base" below briefly mentions other data that Unicode provides.)

This document provides information about the portion of the Unicode database that deals with character properties, that is the portion that is defined on single code points. (Other information in the Unicode data base below briefly mentions other data that Unicode provides.)
trans-unit.target: Este documento proporciona información sobre la parte de la base de datos Unicode que se ocupa de las propiedades de los caracteres, que es la parte que se define en puntos de código único. ( Otra información en la base de datos Unicode a continuación menciona brevemente otros datos que proporciona Unicode).

trans-unit.source: This document reconstructs the history of the CPAN Meta Spec based on change logs, repository commit messages and the published HTML files. In some cases, particularly prior to version 1.2, the exact version when certain fields were introduced or changed is inconsistent between sources. When in doubt, the published HTML files for versions 1.0 to 1.4 as they existed when version 2 was developed are used as the definitive source.
This document serves as both a specification for anyone wishing to implement the DynaLoader for a new platform and as a guide for anyone wishing to use the DynaLoader directly in an application.
trans-unit.target: Este documento sirve tanto como una especificación para cualquiera que desee implementar el DynaLoader para una nueva plataforma como una guía para cualquiera que desee utilizar el DynaLoader directamente en una aplicación.

trans-unit.source: This document takes you through a simple patch example.
trans-unit.target: Este documento te lleva a través de un simple ejemplo de parche.

trans-unit.source: This document varies from difficult to understand to completely and utterly opaque. The wandering prose riddled with jargon is hard to fathom in several places.
trans-unit.target: Este documento varía de difícil de entender a completamente y totalmente opaco.La prosa errante plagada de jerga es difícil de comprender en varios lugares.

trans-unit.source: This document walks through the creation of a small patch to Perl's C code. If you're just getting started with Perl core hacking, this will help you understand how it works.
trans-unit.target: Este documento camina a través de la creación de un pequeño parche para el código C de Perl.Si acabas de empezar a hackear el núcleo de Perl,esto te ayudará a entender cómo funciona.

trans-unit.source: This document was created in February, 2011, and the last major revision was in February, 2013.
trans-unit.target: Este documento fue creado en febrero de 2011,y la última revisión importante fue en febrero de 2013.

This document was last revised on 13-Oct-1998, for Perl 5.004, 5.005, and 5.6.0.
This document was originally written by David Fiander for the 5.005 release of Perl.
trans-unit.target: Este documento fue escrito originalmente por David Fiander para la liberación de Perl a las 5:005.

trans-unit.source: This document was originally written by Nathan Torkington, and is maintained by the perl5-porters mailing list.
trans-unit.target: Este documento fue escrito originalmente por Nathan Torkington,y es mantenido por la lista de correo de perl5-porters.
